solution_line_template: Adam can make {basswood_blocks_owned} x {basswood_figurines_per_block} = <<{basswood_blocks_owned}*{basswood_figurines_per_block}={total_basswood_figurines}>>{total_basswood_figurines} figurines out of the blocks of basswood.

He can also make {basswood_figurines_per_block} x {aspen_multiplier_basswood} = <<{basswood_figurines_per_block}*{aspen_multiplier_basswood}={aspen_figurines_per_block}>>{aspen_figurines_per_block} figurines out of a block of Aspen wood.

So, he can make {aspen_blocks_owned} x {aspen_figurines_per_block} = <<{aspen_blocks_owned}*{aspen_figurines_per_block}={total_aspen_figurines}>>{total_aspen_figurines} figurines out of all the blocks of Aspen wood.

He can also make {butternut_blocks_owned} x {butternut_figurines_per_block} = <<{butternut_blocks_owned}*{butternut_figurines_per_block}={total_butternut_figurines}>>{total_butternut_figurines} figurines out of all the blocks of butternut wood.

Therefore, Adam can make a total of {total_aspen_figurines} + {total_butternut_figurines} + {total_basswood_figurines} = <<{total_aspen_figurines}+{total_butternut_figurines}+{total_basswood_figurines}={total_figurines}>>{total_figurines} figurines using all the blocks of wood.
